comments.commentBody: As long as he keeps fulfilling the GOP wish list, he will have to be caught, gun in hand, robbing a bank, before Congress will even consider impeachment. The integrity of our electoral system is not a high priority for a party that already had a track record of influencing elections through racially targeted state laws and gerrymandering.
this is nothing but a soft coup.
The American public needs to see Trump's tax returns.
Can't wait for "The People Versus Donald J. Trump".  Getting closer and closer with each passing day.

replies.commentBody:
Oh, the Trump line -- "we aren't so innocent either."
Sorry, I'm not rolling over for this one and I'm not ignoring the other misdeeds either.
Like a broken clock that's right twice a day, Trump can stumble upon the truth.  He just happens to use it for really horrific reasons.

comments.commentBody: A lot of hypocrisy gets attached to this issue.  For all you who are so up in arms about this, think about the numerous governments the US has either directly overthrown, or the ones done through covert means.  It is a truly long list.  Sorry, I ain't a-marchin' any more.

Sessions should be indicted for perjury.
This is all going waaaay too far. I am reminded of the Nixon cover-up.
Only this time, the Congress seems to be aware & colluding.
The clock is ticking. We are soon to have a great Reichstag fire of our own to bring opponents to heel and rally the Folk behind our leader.  Wouldnt doubt Bannon is planning something.

replies.commentBody: Comrade, in the name of the immortal congressman Joe Wilson, "You lie."

comments.commentBody: Even those the cia, fbi and the senate int commitee has repeatedly confirm there is nothing to these Russian contact stories NYT continues to spread #FAKENEWS

"Former American officials" ? Really. Is that term really descriptive of these concerned citizens? How about Partisan political hacks doing their best to comply with what the boss wanted the public perception of his successor to be?
It did strike me as odd that when Trump ended Tuesday's speech to the Joint Session with, "God bless these United States.", he omitted 'of America'.  I mean is this a country, or a banana company?
Before Trump is impeached, GOP will use him as a Trojan Horse to pass legislation destroying our country.

In a normal universe these are the events that would unfold - 1) Sessions will resign after being found guilty of perjury during his confirmation hearings. 2) An independent prosecutor will head the enquiry into Russian meddling in US elections. 3) US Congress will subpoena DT's tax returns and we will find what we already know that he is a failed businessman propped by Russian oligarchs (let us leave other salacious material aside). 4) DT will be impeached before the end of his first year in office. 5) Sen Nunes and Burr who were recruited by the WH to deflect charges that DT's campaign had contact with Russians and hence have an inherent conflict in heading the intelligence committee's investigation will be reprimanded, stripped off their committee memberships and will go down in the next election cycle. 7) Mike Pence's administration will be thoroughly vetted. 6) Republican's will lose both senate and house in 2018 and the WH in 2020.
If you think this is a wishful dream, for a moment pause and reflect what should be the punishment for treason?

Trump's opposition to releasing his tax returns...

Trump's lack of will to criticize Putin for what he is....a thug....

Trump and Co.'s opposition to any transparency on their "relationship" with the Russians

just lead to more attention and pressure on his party not to obstruct but to come clean on what happened with the election and with the hacks.

Drip, Drip, Drip.....
Of all the disturbing things that happened during the election, and now after the election .... this is the MOST disturbing.
"Associates" and "sources".  Name some names.

Now we know why Trump has sought to impugn members of our intelligence agencies: they have the goods on him. Trump didn't expect to win the election, but when he did, his associates believed they could bury any intelligence concerning their cozy relationship with Russia. Thanks to dedicated intelligence officials who acted in the best tradition of our nation, we can have an investigation of the improper meetings between Trump campaign officials and representatives of a foreign foe. Mr. Sessions can have nothing to do with this investigation; the claim that his meeting with the Russian ambassador was in his capacity as a member of the senate doesn't pass the smell test given that he was an early and enthusiastic Trump cheerleader.

from today's NYT
"The House majority Leader, Representative Kevin McCarthy, Republican of California, said on MSNBC’s “Morning Joe” that Mr. Sessions “needs to clarify” his testimony".
How do you walk back perjury?
Get ready for a new "Saturday Night Massacre" at Justice and the intelligence agencys.
The Republican members of congress who do not get on board in favor of an impartial investigation are more of a threat to our nation than anyone at Gitmo.

Incredible!  I recall it was Obama who told Medvedev to relay to Putin that after the next election when he won he'd be more flexible.  This tired mem of Russian hacking is old, used so often it's as meaningless as being called a racist by democrats.  I'll tell you this, IF there was information Obama did nothing about it. He did give Iran $'s to fund their terrorism and supply ISIS with weapons to kill Americans, he did allow Hillary to give Putin 20% of the world's uranium in a deal I'll bet he got a healthy commission on, and the democrats have been losing elections since 2010 because of Obama.  Focus on the real issue, it's Obama and find out just what he did to undermine America globally, and why he supported the Muslim Brotherhood and destabilized the middle east further with his venomous anti-Israel position? Libya, Egypt and Syria were NO accidental chain of events.  You need to grow up and understand IF Russia hacked the election maybe they hacked it so Obama would win twice because under Obama, Putin's done extremely well!

I stopped reading this article when I got to "... three former American officials who requested anonymity in discussing classified intelligence."  Seriously?  Poison Pen  information is just that: unpleasant, abusive or malicious statements or accusations about Trump and/or his administration don't hold water without corroborative information.  How convenient is it to 'report' on something that couldn't possibly verified without declassifying intelligence reporting? And you know why the three former American officials requested anonymity?  Because they'd go to jail.  The Democrats need to let this go and move on.  I realize that the loss of the Presidency was a significant shock to their overzealous progressive ideals, but they should stop trying to place the blame on anyone or anything other than themselves.  And Hillary.  It was mostly Hillary's fault.

So, it's illegal for anybody in the Trump administration to talk to anyone in Russia.  Hacking into Podestas email account and Wikileaks releasing all the stuff on Hillary, the corruption isn't the story ?  The story is Russia corrupted the election ?  This story has already been discredited.  Nobody corrupted the election.  Reporting emails showing Hillary's and the DNC's corruption is not illegal.  CNN giving Hillary the debate questions in advance, that's corruption

This entire front-page article is based on alleged anonymous conversations with "Former American officials"

The new, failing New York Times mandate: If there's no news fit to print, make it up. Fiction. Fake news. Click bait. By your own admission you are conducting a smear campaign against our own country and its leadership.

You have no journalistic integrity. You have no integrity. You are misleading people. You misreport hearsay as fact, and when there's no hearsay, you just invent allegations. That is your new mandate. How can professional liars tell their own children not to lie? How do you live with yourselves?

If the Clilnton's did not have the attitude of " do anything for what we want" the emails would not exist in the first place.
The tragedy of this election is the American people were given Trump and Clinton. To blame the Russians for the election is nuts.
The people should fear Steve Bannon and Jeff Sessons.

When the investigations play out and Trump is removed from office, let's hope that this time there is no merciful replacement president (Pence or Ryan) on hand to pardon him. The Donald in chains being marched off to a federal prison should draw some very high ratings on tv. I would not want to miss that show.

The Clinton administration told the incoming Bush administration about Bin Laden.  The Bush administration decide not to do anything about it.  Of course we all know what happen next.  The best thing that trump can do for the good of the country after he shares his taxes is resign.  This not going to get better.  We do not need to get into another war because trump thinks it is a good idea.  After all his sons are not going to join the military.  They are much to busy drumming up business on the government dime.

The Russians and Robert Mercer have effectively undermined our entire Republic. Is it really such a stretch that Cambridge Analytics worked in conjunction with the Russians? Two votes per precinct in Michigan is awfully convenient..
